column1: aggression first up! Floated on off stump, shimmies down the wicket, and slogged over mid on's head
full on off stump, driven down the ground to cover

The bails are dislodged, but what's happened here? No one really knows. Sarfraz and Nawaz are celebrating though. Good-length ball on off stump and zipping straight through. Akmal's beaten for pace, and yes, the ball brushes past the outside of off stump. Goes for a golden duck
full on leg stump, and Smith misses his front-foot defense. Hits his front pad, but would've gone down leg
full on off stump, makes room opening his stance, and tapped to mid off
fuller ball to end the over. Pitches on off stump, and straightens. Forces the batsman to go deep, and defend
full on off stump, bunted back down the ground with minimal footwork
slashes hard at it, but over cover point! Risky, but lands just beyond the fielder. Full outside off, and gave it a wild heave. Not the best of connections from DR
full on off stump, driven hard down the ground, but only to mid off

cuts him in half! Good length on off stump, and tails inwards. Goes between his bat and pad, and through to the keeper. Dips as it goes to Sarfraz. Could've easily taken the top of off stump. Beautiful delivery
back of a length just outside off, stands tall and blocks off the back foot
good length outside off, tries to pull, but the ball does rise high enough. Bottom-edges his leg-side shot towards square leg
full on off stump, prods forward and defends back to Nawaz
full on middle stump, angles inwards, but Smith's up to the challenge. Defended
full on off stump, big wind up from Smith and slogged towards the leg side. Smacked over midwicket, but doesn't have the legs to go all the way
full on middle stump, big stride forward and defended towards the off side

full on off stump, another wild heave from Smith this time. Just about enough behind that slog to take it over mid off. Couple of bounces and into the boundary. On another day, he would've holed out to the fielder
big appeal for lbw, but the umpire's not interested. Full on middle and Smith misses the sweep. Hits his front leg, but would've gone down the leg side
full just outside off, takes a few steps down the ground tapped to mid off
back of a length outside off, stands tall and punches off the back foot to point. They scamper across
back of a length outside off, flat-batted back past the bowler to mid on. The fielder races to his left and intercepts
slower ball on middle stump, deceives the batsman, who misses the leg-side flick. Hits his pad and through to point
good length on middle stump, slower ball again and Smith plays at it with hard hands. Can only mistime it back towards the non-striker
another slower ball to end the over. Big wind up from Smith, but can't connect well with that slog. Mistimed towards midwicket
full on off stump, pushed towards the leg side, but no chance of a run
good length on middle stump, stays on the back foot and flicked towards square leg
good length on middle and leg, can only punch it back to Nawaz. Cramped for space
good length on off stump, backs away towards the leg side and that's enough room for him to free his arms. Pulled over cow corner! Punished for bowling just a bit short
two in a row! Fuller ball on middle stump, but Smith predicted that length. Huge stride forward and muscled over the bowler's head. Falls 10 metres over the boundary
full on middle and leg, slightly flatter this time. Defended towards cover
good length on middle stump, uses his wrists to flick off his hips to the man deep on the leg side
good length on off stump, opens his bat's face and pokes it towards point. Slight misfield by the man there
good length outside off, plays the late cut this time. Runs it down to third man for a walking single
full just outside off, but it's the offcutter this time. Angles away from Smith after pitching. He tried to muscle this over the bowler's head, but can't connect at all
yorker on middle stump. Does well to get his front foot out of the way and squeeze it towards cover point. Quick!

play-and-a-miss to end the Powerplay. Good length on off stump and Hafeez came charging down the ground. Tries to drag it towards the leg side, but the ball goes under his bat. Just about misses the top of middle stump

tossed up outside off, Smith tries to slog it over Hassan, and just about manages to get enough behind it. Toe ends it, but powerfully played. Those big arms allow it to fall beyond the long-off boundary
slapped! Tossed up slightly wider outside off, but Smith's up to the challenge. Down on one knee and slog-sweeped over cow corner. He's on a roll!
drops his length now. Good length wide outside off, Smith goes deep and punches to mid on
good length on middle stump, makes some room towards the leg side and punched towards cover
full on off stump, angling inwards and driven past the bowler's left
back of a length outside off, mistimes his back-foot punch to long on. He'll keep strike
full outside off, driven with the bat's open face past cover. Starts off with a slower ball
good length on leg stumps, can't flick it towards the leg side. Hits him high on the front leg
good length on middle stump, inside-edges his back-foot punch towards square leg
full on leg stump, comfortably clipped off his toes to fine leg
short outside leg stump, and soars over his head. No call from either umpire and Hafeez has some words to say
good length on middle stump, angling across his body as he tries to slash hard at it. Goes just past the outside of his bat and through to Sarfraz. That's also the fifty partnership
good length on middle stump, and pulled furiously over cow corner! Nawaz the man in the deep, but he has no chance. Flew off the bat! Phew
full outside off, driven uppishly, but comes off the bat's top half. Soft catch at cover. Misses out on the half century
good length just outside off stump, prods forward and taps it towards cover
full on middle stump, angling into him, flicked off his pads to midwicket
back of a length outside off, and it's a slower ball. Goes over Wessels' shoulders and through to Sarfraz
full on off stump, angles into the batsman. Turned off his pads towards square leg on this occasion
full on off stump, and angling across. Driven inside out over mid off, and lands just inside the long-off boundary. Full swing of the bat, and nothing else really. Excellent from the prof
good length on middle stump, tiptoes and turns it off his hips to deep midwicket
full outside off stump, walks across towards the off side and driven to cover point
outswinging yorker on middle and off. Dug back to mid off, but the non-striker wants the run. Mix-up, but he's quick to turn back. Could've been close
good length on middle stump, nudged off his pads to square leg. Wessels wants the second, but Hafeez says no
short on middle stump, goes onto the back foot, and swivels to deep midwicket. Only a single for that beautiful looking shot
drifting in short on middle, he makes room and punches this to sweeper cover
turns this from middle and leg towards square leg
leading edge, nearly lobbed back to the bowler. Nawaz crashes into the non-striker as he runs to his right to try and take that
steps out and launches this hit over long-on. Didn't get to the pitch of the delivery but went through with the stroke. Mishit to be honest, but somehow he's lucky to see this sail over.

crunching cut shot. Too short, he rocks back, makes room to open up the off side and gives this a trash. The length was a result of the batsman stepping out off the previous delivery. Poor effort from Rahat at deep point
turns this into the leg side as they scamper a legbye
hint of width outside off, steers this down to square third man
gentle little dab into the off side, they scamper even as the throw comes in from point to the bowler's end
looks to hoick this but can only hit it as far as Shane Watson at midwicket. Watto nearly dropped that. Somehow recovered to take it on the second attempt.
uppish but straight to mid-off
swivels back and pulls this short ball into the gap at deep backward square leg, the non-striker was halfway down the pitch for the second when he was sent back
short ball that gets stuck into the pitch, was through with the pull early. This hits him on the body.
floats this full on middle and leg, turned to midwicket
length on middle and leg, tucked towards deep backward square leg
cleverly done. Walks across to pull but ends up dabbing this down to third man as he sees Watson bang this short ball way outside off
steers this away-going length ball down to square third man
too full on the pads, he walks across the stumps and whips this to deep square leg
sashays down the pitch and then carves this full delivery to Rahat at deep point. This just flew off the blade

flies off the edge to backward point. Done in by the extra pace and bounce. This just took off to hit the top part of the bat as Khushdil tried to defend. Initially looked to pull but got done in by the surface.
stands tall and punch this to point
slower length ball on the pads, tucked to midwicket
gets into position quickly and pulls this short ball to deep midwicket
gets the direction completely wrong. Ends up spraying this way down leg, good take by the keeper.
stands tall and whips this into the gap at deep backward square leg
awkward bounce. Looks to get on top of it and help it down to third man but is cramped for room. Beaten.
smashed one bounce to wide mid-off. Didn't get the elevation he would've liked.
slower and fuller outside off, he looked to heave this from way outside off and ends up dragging it towards square leg
is he giving catching practice or what? Pulled from outside off to midwicket. The short ball didn't really arrive, he didn't time it well either. Peshawar sliding
sparkling drive but straight to mid-off

this is a sensational inswinging yorker that was honed in towards Sammy's left toe. He just manages to squeeze it out but in doing so, the ball could've so easily bounced onto the stumps. Sammy has the presence of mind to kick it away too.
short and wide outside off, Sammy lets this go assuming it'd be called wide. Umpire reckons it's fine.
drilled to the deep extra cover fence. Too full, he had room as he got to the pitch and gave this a whack
shapes to cut but is beaten by sharp turn. Wasn't all that short either

shapes to play a reverse sweep but the ball drifts in, straightens and hits him on the thigh. Height not in question really. The only thing that would've saved him was a thin inside edge. There's a very, very small spike but the only thing it can come in contact is the bat. So he will get away with it. Decision overturned
backs away and slaps this short ball to cover
bunts this past the bowler towards long-on
eased into the cover region as Sammy gets off the mark. He's still hobbling.
belts this waist-high full toss over mid-off. Swatted that away disdainfully
toe-ends an attempted slog down to long-on
straight, full and into his swinging arc. This has been deposited into the second tier, way over long-on. Didn't try to hit it hard, the timing - simply incredible
eases this short delivery to deep cover
miscues a slog, mid-on, long-off and cover run towards the ball but this plonks between all three
slower length ball on off stump, eased wide of cover
walloped across the line and gets this over deep midwicket. He dragged this from outside off but still managed to get enough wood on it.
drills this full delivery down to long-on
makes room to go over the top, Laughlin follows him and bowls a toe-crusher, dabbed into the leg side for a single
looked to steer this behind point but was beaten by the slowness. Bailed out of the shot
pulled behind square, beats the man at deep backward square leg. Too short, too slow and this was sitting up nicely
smashed back past the bowler, who is lucky to have not got a finger on it even as he put his right hand out instinctively. I reckon he would've chipped a nail had he got something on that
slapped past mid-off. So what if he's limping? He can still muscle them. Made room and used the angle to whack this into the gap
swing and a miss. Looked to pull but was through the stroke way too early
right into the blockhole, leaves Sammy having no option but to simply block and run. This was right towards his toe
scooped over short fine leg. Too predictable the length this time. Walked across and simply ramped this away
looks to squeeze this behind point but is beaten
drills this down to wide long-on
tries to reverse paddle a low full toss, this tailed in to hit him on the pad but off the pad. There was an appeal for lbw but it wasn't given. Quetta reviewed but the decision can't be reversed.
super yorker, tailing in to leave him no option but to jam his bat down. Sammy gets a thick inside edge to the fine leg boundary
whips this to short fine where Watson pulls off a fine stop
down on one knee as he squeezes the drive straight to mid-off

backs away, uses the width and carves a flat six over deep cover. Used the depth of the crease superbly. The high backlift did the trick as it helped bring the momentum down into the stroke. Sensational stuff
drills this down to long-on, can't get the elevation
good length outside off, spinning away from him. Cut to point
off to the deep point boundary! Cut away
good length on off stump, backs away and carves it to point. They race across for the run
good length on off stump once again, tapped to cover point this time
full on middle stump, driven straight back to the bowler
full on off stump, big stride forward and driven to mid off
back of a length outside off, angling into the batsman's body. Pulled along the ground to deep midwicket
back of a length outside off, goes deep onto the back foot and punched past cover. No stopping that!
carbon copy! Same ball, good length outside off, and comfortably punched off the back foot past point. Shifts all his body weight onto the back foot and carves it thereafter
good length on off stump, goes onto the back foot, and tapped to midwicket
good length on middle stump, shuffles across to the off side and flicks to deep backward square
back of a length outside off stump. Extra zip off the surface this time, and soars over the batsman's attempted pull. Through to the keeper
full on off stump, swinging away from the batsman. Mistimes his front-foot drive to mid off
good length wide outside off, tries to cut but the ball goes over his bat. Nice carry through to the keeper. Misses out on this ball that had some extra width
good length on off stump, backs away and flat bats it towards the non-striker. Off the bat's top half
good length on off stump, angles into Watson with the batsman backing away. Carved away to cover
full on off stump, tries to line the leg-side flick, but misses the shot completely. Off his bat and onto his pads
good length on off stump, punched off the back foot to cover point
good length on middle stump, Watson shuffles across to the leg side, and taps to midwicket
full on middle stump, goes onto the back foot and drags a leg-side heave towards deep midwicket
good length on middle and off, bunted back to the bowler off the back foot
good length wide outside off, goes onto the back foot and cuts hard. Powerfully played, and uses his wrists well to play it between cover point and point
good length, but wide outside off. Turns into him. Cut to cover point. No run this time
full on off stump, down on one knee and smacked over cow corner! What a hit. Soars over the man positioned there
the extra pace earns him the wicket! Quick and short outside off, tails into Shafiq, and his leading edge goes straight to cover. Soft dismissal
good length on off stump, goes onto the back foot and defends back to Hasan
full on off stump, walks down the wicket and drives down the ground. Hit well, and chase for mid off. Retrieves it though
good length outside off, mistimes his drive to cover, but that lack of speed allows them to scamper across for the quick run
full on off stump, it's the slower ball, and his leg-side heave is played too early. Manages to hit it, nonetheless, and drags his shot to deep backward square
good length on off stump, shuffles across to the off side and nudges it to Wessels at deep backward square
full on off stump, defended off the front foot. Pinged to cover
full on off stump, angles across him. Tries to drive inside out but can't connect. Through to the keeper
yorker on middle stump, dug back to Wahab Riaz. Well managed
falls just beyond short fine leg! Short on middle stump, and pulled over the infield. Top edged, really, but enough behind that to trickle down to the boundary
full on off stump, tries to drive away from his body, and inside edged towards the leg side. Played that shot down the wrong line
full on off stump, driven to mid on. No run. Minimal footwork from the batsman
back of a length on off stump, goes deep onto the back foot and carved to cover point
full on off stump, tries to tee off down the ground, but mis-hits it. Off the bottom of his bat, and through to the man at long on
thumped over cover! Full and wide outside off, manages to get under this delivery and smacked over the infield. No one bothered moving there
back of a length outside off stump, rocks back and pulls over midwicket. Falls between wide long on and deep midwicket. Excellent placement
full outside of, and spins inwards. Tries a slog-sweep towards the leg side, but mistimed to deep midwicket
short on middle stump, muscled off the back foot to deep midwicket. He'll keep strike
good length on off stump, tries to muscle this over to the leg side, but mistimed. Once again to the man in the deep

there's the big wicket! Short on middle, and Watson walks across to the off side to try and paddle this fine. Can't hit it well enough, and it's a feather touch that goes to the keeper's left. Soft dismissal
tests him with the short ball first up. Lands on middle stump and soars over his head. Tried to pull, but nowhere near that shot
good length on off stump, walks across to the off side and covers his stumps. Defended off the back foot
low full toss on off stump, tapped back by Rameez. Off the bat's toe end
back of a length outside off, tailing into him. Punched off the back foot to cover point
good length on off stump, defended off the back foot to cover
full on off stump, slaps this past the vacant cover area to the man in the deep. Only a single
good length on middle stump, flicked off his pads to deep midwicket
just over long on! That was full on off stump, and he walks down the wicket and smacks it over the bowler's head. Excellent sound off the bat
another one! DJ Khaled would be proud of that. Full on off stump, and this time the six is muscled over long off! Simply the full followthrough of the bat
good length outside off, backs away and cut to point
KP's walking! The bowler has the last laugh. Good length outside off, and this one zips straight through. Pietersen tries to cut, but he's edged it
full on off stump, smacked down the ground to long off
good length on off stump, spins into the left-hander. Tapped to midwicket
full outside off, spinning inwards and it's reverse swept! Beats short third man, and no stopping that!
good length on off stump, cramps him for room. Punched towards the non-striker
short and wide outside off, walks down the ground and smacks it to deep midwicket
ends the tenth with a maximum! Full outside off, and he meets the ball on the full. And lifts it - inside out - over cover. Terrific shot to end the over
there's an appeal for lbw but this one rolls off the back thigh to third man. Looked to play the short arm jab but was beaten for pace
length on off, slices this down to third man
chance at the non-striker's end, but Wahab misses. Once again beaten for pace as he looks to work this to the leg side. Legbye taken

the change of pace has done the trick and Quetta are sliding. Rameez hops back and looks to work this length ball off his hip but it doesn't arrive, he closes the bat face too early and ends up getting a leading edge to Sammy who takes a dolly at midwicket.
delicately done. So typical of Sarfraz. Smart batting. Hint of width to this delivery angling away, he uses the pace to simply dab this past the keeper and beats short third man.
crisp drive to deep cover point
drifting into middle and leg, tucked to midwicket
down on one knee as he sweeps this fiercely on the bounce to deep midwicket
tossed up on middle, he lunges forward and defends this into the off side

shapes to sweep and gets into an ugly tangle as the ball strikes him full but the impact was outside off, or so it seems. Liam Dawson has asked for a review. First thoughts: Missing off. There's a hint of glove as well. Can't be given even if it would've gone on to hit. Decision upheld
stunning stroke. Backs away, gets under the length and lofts this inside-out over extra cover. Superb
steps out and lofts this down towards long-on
sharp turn and bounce. Sarfraz looks to run this down but this wasn't all that short. Beaten
swept from outside off, picks the gap between deep square and deep midwicket. Outstanding batsmanship
gentle push into the off side as they scamper a single
too short, he rocks back and pulls to deep midwicket
nice drift, but he waits for the turn and then dabs this into the off side
steps out and drills this tossed up delivery down to long-on. Got too close to the pitch of the delivery and couldn't get the elevation as a result.
yorker-length delivery that tails late to hit him on the pad.
backs away to slap this but the slower length ball holds onto the surface, dabbed into the off side
angling into middle and leg, worked off his hip to deep square
floats this full outside leg stump as he sees the batsman backing away, squeezed to sweeper cover
mistimes this hook shot down to fine leg, the ball got big on him
slower length ball on leg stump, he backs away to slash. This gets stuck onto the pitch and lobs off the top part of the bat to the off side
yorker that tails away late, squeezed into the off side for a quick single
this is a crunching drive, the cover fielder thought this wasn't too far from him and hared back, only to see the ball gather pace. Superb
turns this gently into the square leg region for an easy single
backs away and dabs this behind point for a quick single
pulled to deep square, fetched it from outside off
beaten by the slowness of the surface as he backs away to cut, ends up defending back to the bowler
nearly chopped on! Too close for him to play the delicate dab to third man, gets a thick inside edge that rolls off the pad to the off side
mistimes a hoick down towards deep midwicket, excellent running to scamper back for the second
bottom-edges a cut that races to the third man boundary. Fortune favours the brave, this wasn't far from the keeper.
right into the blockhole, squeezed out
reverse swing, another superb yorker that's been turned to deep midwicket
works this off his hip to deep midwicket
spears in a superb yorker from around the stumps, squeezed towards point. A direct hit at the bowler's end and Rossouw would've been gone
driven back past the bowler to mid-off

the umpire was in danger of being smashed on the head by that flat-batted slap. Too short, he backed away and literally gave this a thump. Shah had to duck for cover quickly, this one whizzed past his ears.
pulled into the deep midwicket region for an easy single
looks to belt this over mid-on but gets a thick inside edge towards midwicket
full and tailing away from middle, turned to the leg side
looked for a yorker, but turned out to be a full toss that beat the batsman's swing. Too quick even for Kamran because the ball hit a spot and just took off. That's really tough on the keeper.
length outside off, beaten as he looks to cut this
threads the gap between cover and mid-off. Wahab didn't do much wrong. Slower length ball angling away, he backed away to open up the off side and nail this
thick outside edge to this yorker, down to third man

given out lbw as he misses a full toss that tails in to hit his left pad. First impression was it may have been missing. Proved right on replay. All three stumps were visible at the point of impact. Decision overturned as Rossouw reviews
yorker on middle and leg, gets a thick inside edge to fine leg
steps out and punches this to mid-off for a quick single
backs away and pulls this into the gap at deep midwicket
full on middle, he makes room and squeezes the drive to the edge of the ring at mid-off
short on middle, pulled to deep square leg
backs away and drills this down to long-on
full outside off, he makes room and thumps this to the deep extra cover boundary to level the scores. Unbelievable timing

pulled on the bounce to deep midwicket. Hugs in the dugout as Sir Viv runs up to Moin Khan. Game set and match. What a partnership this between Rossouw and Sarfraz. What this result also means is the curtains come down on Lahore's campaign. They can't progress into the final four anymore.
